nodes.documentation:
@title SafeMath
@dev Unsigned math operations with safety checks that revert on error
nodes.name: SafeMath

nodes.documentation: @dev Multiplies two unsigned integers, reverts on overflow.
nodes.name: mul

nodes.documentation: @dev Integer division of two unsigned integers truncating the quotient, reverts on division by zero.
nodes.name: div

nodes.documentation: @dev Subtracts two unsigned integers, reverts on overflow (i.e. if subtrahend is greater than minuend).
nodes.name: sub

nodes.documentation: @dev Adds two unsigned integers, reverts on overflow.
nodes.name: add

nodes.documentation:
@dev Divides two unsigned integers and returns the remainder (unsigned integer modulo),
reverts when dividing by zero.
nodes.name: mod
Ownable

nodes.documentation:
@dev The Ownable constructor sets the original `owner` of the contract to the sender
account.
@return the address of the owner.
nodes.name: owner

nodes.documentation: @dev Throws if called by any account other than the owner.
nodes.name: onlyOwner

nodes.documentation: @return true if `msg.sender` is the owner of the contract.
nodes.name: isOwner
renounceOwnership

nodes.documentation:
@dev Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.
@param newOwner The address to transfer ownership to.
nodes.name: transferOwnership

nodes.documentation:
@dev Transfers control of the contract to a newOwner.
@param newOwner The address to transfer ownership to.
nodes.name: _transferOwnership

@title ERC20 interface
@dev see https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20

nodes.documentation:
@title ERC20 interface
@dev see https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20
nodes.name: IERC20

isOwner().return: true if `msg.sender` is the owner of the contract.

renounceOwnership().details: Allows the current owner to relinquish control of the contract.

transferOwnership(address).details: Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.

params.newOwner: The address to transfer ownership to.

renounceOwnership().notice: Renouncing to ownership will leave the contract without an owner. It will not be possible to call the functions with the `onlyOwner` modifier anymore.
